page.title: 13CHILD'S VIEW 2-S OF BARRHEAD
page.content: continued from page 12 The{Craigie}is used by many people in the town for many different reasons. Each year the{Craigie Race}takes place on Barrhead's{Gala Day}from the centre of town to the summit and return. The {Guides}and{Scouts}use it for{sausage {sizzles.}You can go and{fish,}go on a{ {family outing,}or even a{school {outing.}The view is lovely too. You can go{camping}and have a{treasure {hunt}or go in{swimming}with your dog in the dam. You can go for{nature {walks.}There are a lot of places to hide and play{hide and seek.}You can come down it easily but you can't get up it as easily. On{Easter Sunday}we {roll our eggs}down the Craigie and go exploring all over the place. You need to join a club before you can fish but you can watch birds or study the wild flowers as there are lots about.
